creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: large trunk with three panel top; inlaid foliate paktong lockplate; molded edged; cloud shaped upper corner plates, c-shaped handles; dark finish; molded stepped plinth; bottom comes off
text: Although once quite common, very few hardwood storage trunks have survived intact. Given its size, this one was likely used to store articles of clothing and was kept in residential quarters, especially the bedrooms of upper class households.
title: Clothes Trunk
